channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-970] Id query cannot be created if object to remove is DBObject
item.description:
If we in insert DBObject in database used method:

protected void populateIdIfNecessary(Object savedObject, Object id) {
 
  if (id == null) {
 
    return;
 
  }
 
  if (savedObject instanceof BasicDBObject) {
 
    DBObject dbObject = (DBObject) savedObject;
 
    dbObject.put(ID_FIELD, id);
 
    return;
 
  }
 
  MongoPersistentProperty idProp = getIdPropertyFor(savedObject.getClass());
 
  if (idProp == null) {
 
    return;
 
  }
 
  ConversionService conversionService = mongoConverter.getConversionService();
 
  BeanWrapper<PersistentEntity<Object, ?>, Object> wrapper = BeanWrapper.create(savedObject, conversionService);
 
  Object idValue = wrapper.getProperty(idProp, idProp.getType(), true);
 
  if (idValue != null) {
 
    return;
 
  }
 
  wrapper.setProperty(idProp, id);
 
}

where checked: 'savedObject instanceof BasicDBObject' and not store property with '_id'. Then if we remove DBObject from database for create query used:

private Query getIdQueryFor(Object object) {
 
  Assert.notNull(object);
 
  Class<?> objectType = object.getClass();
 
  MongoPersistentEntity<?> entity = mappingContext.getPersistentEntity(objectType);
 
  MongoPersistentProperty idProp = entity == null ? null : entity.getIdProperty();
 
  if (idProp == null) {
 
    throw new MappingException("No id property found for object of type " + objectType);
 
  }
 
  ConversionService service = mongoConverter.getConversionService();
 
  Object idProperty = null;
 
  idProperty = BeanWrapper.create(object, service).getProperty(idProp, Object.class, true);
 
  return new Query(where(idProp.getFieldName()).is(idProperty));
 
}

Where not checked: 'savedObject instanceof BasicDBObject' and throw exception. Why not checked removing object on 'savedObject instanceof BasicDBObject' if we insert BAsicDBObject and after remove then.
item.summary: Id query cannot be created if object to remove is DBObject

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I am totally sorry, but I don't get what you're shooting for at all. Any chance you're trying to rephrase the question again? I'd be interested to see what you're doing, what you expect to happen and what (you think erroneously) happens. A test case for example.

Let's do it using example:

We create new dbObject:

DBObject dbObjects = new BasicDbObject();

and insert it using the org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.insert(Object, String). Where 'Object' = dbObject, 'String' = collection name and then I remove dbObject using the org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.remove(Object, String), Where 'Object' = dbObject, 'String' = collection name.

But I have:

org.springframework.data.mapping.model.MappingException: No id property found for object of type class com.mongodb.BasicDBObject
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.getIdQueryFor(MongoTemplate.java:1085)
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.remove(MongoTemplate.java:1067)

In code I see at insert:

Object id = insertDBObject(collectionName, dbDoc, objectToSave.getClass());
 
populateIdIfNecessary(objectToSave, id);

and in method populateIdIfNecessary(objectToSave, id);:

     if (savedObject instanceof BasicDBObject) {
 
        DBObject dbObject = (DBObject) savedObject;
 
        dbObject.put(ID_FIELD, id);
 
       return;
 
     }

and code :

MongoPersistentProperty idProp = getIdPropertyFor(savedObject.getClass());
 
if (idProp == null) {
 
	return;
 
}
 
ConversionService conversionService = mongoConverter.getConversionService();
 
BeanWrapper<PersistentEntity<Object, ?>, Object> wrapper = BeanWrapper.create(savedObject, conversionService);
 
Object idValue = wrapper.getProperty(idProp, idProp.getType(), true);
 
if (idValue != null) {
 
	return;
 
}
 
wrapper.setProperty(idProp, id);

is not executed.

But at remove execute method org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.getIdQueryFor(Object):
And inside is executed: 

Class<?> objectType = object.getClass();
 
MongoPersistentEntity<?> entity = mappingContext.getPersistentEntity(objectType);
 
MongoPersistentProperty idProp = entity == null ? null : entity.getIdProperty();
 
if (idProp == null) {
 
	throw new MappingException("No id property found for object of type " + objectType);
 
}

The question was: Why in method org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.getIdQueryFor(Object) not checked if object is BasicDBObject? Sorry for my bad English.

Going forward, if you post a lot of code, please use the formatting tags as we need to add them later on to make sure someonee can wrap her head around what you were posting. Also, posting a lot of the library code usually just makes things harder to digest.

I came up with the following test case which creates the exception you see:

/**
 
 * @see DATAMONGO-970
 
 */
 
@Test
 
public void insertsAndRemovesBasicDbObjectCorrectly() {
 
 
 
	BasicDBObject object = new BasicDBObject("key", "value");
 
	template.insert(object, "collection");
 
 
 
	assertThat(object.get("_id"), is(notNullValue()));
 
 
 
	template.remove(object, "collection");
 
	assertThat(template.findAll(DBObject.class, "collection"), hasSize(0));
 
}

Thank you, I will keep it in mind
Yes, that's what I meant.
So, is it a problem? Or I should by myselft solve this situation?
This should be fixed in both the master and the bugfix branch. Feel free to give the snapshots a spin.
